Race Day

The race is held in Clifden, Co Galway and starts at the Court House, across from the Topaz petrol station. It is an out and back route, which goes up the scenic Sky road and while walkers will be able to enjoy the beautiful scenery and views of Clifden Bay, it is challenging enough for any serious runners. It returns by the Thomas Whelan Memorial, to finish outside the Alcock and Brown Hotel in the town centre. From the Start at the Court House, follow the N59 towards Westport for about 100 metres, before taking the first left onto Churchill. Follow this road to the end. Keep right onto the Sky Road. Continue for about 4 kms where you will see a rough road branching to the right into a quarry. This is your turn back point. You cannot miss it, as there will be a water station and race marshalls in attendance.
Follow us on Facebook Follow us on Facebook Follow us on Facebook Follow us on Facebook
Race Route
Return the same way, down the Sky Road, as far as Churchill, but at the junction, follow the marshalls instruction and keep right. Keep on this road, past the Thomas Whelan Memorial on your right and straight ahead towards The Square, where marshalls will direct you to the finish line outside the Alcock and Brown Hotel.
The route is accuratly measured by an AAI official, and will be well marked out with markers at every kms (on the road). Marshalls will be in attendance at every junction
Click here to see the race route
Race Route
You must give your race number to the marshall at this point before turning back
